quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Bands
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leader, crickets. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Why did Mark Oliver Everett, a.k.a. E name his band The Eels?

options.text: because he considered the name Feels at first, but then dropped the F
because he wanted their records to be close to his solo records in an alphabetical order
Because he loved them as food

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because he wanted their records to be close to his solo records in an alphabetical order

questions.question: This jazz great is a second generation  trombonist. His career really took off in the 1960s. Most people know him for his work in the Merv Griffin Show orchestra and with the group Ten Wheel Drive. Jazz aficionados know him for his rendition of Sam Nesticos arrangement of  A Time To Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Watrous

questions.question: Which member of Def Leppard came up with the bands name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Elliott

questions.question: This trombonist and band leader, whose orchestra was very influential in the pre-WWII era, was killed in WWII by friendly fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glenn Miller

questions.question: What was The Pussycat Dollss debut single, recorded in 2004?

options.text: We Went as Far as We Felt Like Going

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sway

questions.question: How was the fictional band The Monkees from the American television series The Monkees often described?

options.text: Four boys who have too much spare time
Four boys who can only sing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four insane boys

questions.question: What name containing an animal was considered initially when choosing a name for The Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny and the Moondogs

questions.question: Why were The Animals nicknamed animals which turned into the bands official name?

options.text: because the lead vocalist was called Tiger
because they used animal sounds in their music
because they were pretty wild on the stage

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because they were pretty wild on the stage

questions.question: This Detroit-born musician started out as a guitarist and switched to the trombone at 14. After WWII he played with many of the top bands and musicians. He was closely associated  with the group SuperSax. In 1978 he committed suicide in Los Angeles. The International Trombone Association has an award named for him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Rosolino

questions.question: What was the former name of American heavy metal band Lamb of God?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burn the Priest

questions.question: This Pennsylvania-born trombonist played with some of the finest bands starting at age 16. In 1934 he and his brother formed their own band. Although they were successful, they separated in 1935 and formed separate bands. His biggest hits were Marie and Opus One.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy Dorsey

questions.question: What famous comedian wrote in their autobiographical book Born Standing Up that Glenn Frey was very particular that the name of his band was Eagles and not The Eagles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Martin

questions.question: What was the name of Whitesnakes debut album, released in 1978?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snakebite

questions.question: This Grammy Award-winning musician is one of the few left-handed trombonists. He became Llod Prices musical director after playing with many of the top groups. He appeared on The Cosby Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slide Hampton

questions.question: When choosing a name for their band, The Crickets nearly opted for this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beetles

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Destinys Child and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, singles, destinys. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1996 Destinys Child got their final name. How exactly did that happen?

options.text: Beyonce came up with the new name.
LeToya Luckett, who joined the group in 1993, suggested that name.
Their record label insisted that they should change the name from Destiny to Destinys Child.
Tina Knowles, Beyonces mother, took it from a passage in the Book of Isaiah.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Knowles, Beyonces mother, took it from a passage in the Book of Isaiah.

questions.question: What was the name of Destinys Childs second studio album, released July 27, 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Writings on The Wall

questions.question: In December 1999 these two members of Destinys Child left the group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: LaTavia and LeToya

questions.question: Which of these singles was included in Destinys Child fourth album Destiny Fulfilled?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Pigpens last show with the Grateful Dead was at this venue on June 17th 1972.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hollywood Bowl

questions.question: The Grateful Dead kicked off an eight-night run on October 22th 1980 at which of these venues?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Radio City Music Hall

questions.question: On September 16th 1978, the Grateful Dead performed at this highly revered location.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gizah sound and light theatre

questions.question: In 1997 Destinys Child signed to Columbia Records. What was the name of the first song they recorded that year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Killing Time

questions.question: Which of these is one of the former names of Destinys Child?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: After nearly 5 months off for medical reasons surrounding Jerry, the Grateful Dead performed here on December 15th 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oakland Coliseum

questions.question: Destinys Child did a remix of their song No, No, No together with this huge RB and hip hop star.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wyclef Jean

questions.question: Destinys child worked with producer Timbaland on this song which is the third single from their debut album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Get on the Bus

questions.question: This 2001 album by Destinys Child was certified four times platinum in the United States in 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Survivor

questions.question: What was the original name of Destinys Child long before they became famous?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Girls Tyme

questions.question: At which of these east coast venues did the Grateful Dead perform on November 11th 1978?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NBC Studios

questions.question: What was the name of the first album recorded by  My Chemical Romance?

options.text: I Brought Your My Love, You Brought Me Your Bullets
I Brought You My Bullets, You Brought Me Your Love

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Brought You My Bullets, You Brought Me Your Love

questions.question: The following lyrics are from what song by My Chemical Romance:

options.text: d oh, you look so tired
Honey, This Mirror Isnt Big Enough For The Both Of Us

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack the Ripper

questions.question: Gerard Way, famous as frontman and co-founder of My Chemical Romance, was born on April 9, 1977.

options.text: The Smiths: Girlfriend in a Coma

questions.question: What crooner helped Ray Charles with Everybody Has the Blues?

questions.question: Gerard Way, one of the founding members of My Chemical Romance, played Peter Pan in a school play.

questions.question: After the release of their first album, My Chemical Romance toured with The Used.

It was originally written in Spanish.
It was originally a love song.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lena Horne and Accordion
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, jackson, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Lena Horne never married.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In a very famous photo, Graham Washington Jackson plays accordion while he is crying. Why was he crying?

options.text: Martin Luther King, Jr. was killed.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt died.

questions.question: Idi Amin, Mahatma Gandhi, Bruce Hornsby, and Sarit Hadad all play or played accordion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which one of these otherwise great men did not play the accordion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Truman

questions.question: This man, who is considered the Henry Ford of accordion production, was the first person to mass produce the accordion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mathias Hohner

questions.question: When was Lena Horne born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: June 30, 1917

questions.question: In 1933 Lena Horne joined what famous clubs chorus line?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cotton Club

questions.question: This man was the first accordionist to make it big in the jazz world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Art Van Damme

questions.question: In 1985 Ms. Lena Horne appeared as herself on what popular television sitcom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cosby Show

questions.question: Lena Horne received a high school diploma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This musician played accordion on Born in Time from his album Under the Red Sky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: What were the names of Lena Hornes children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gail and Edwin

questions.question: Lena Horne is reportedly a descendant of what US Vice President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John C.Calhoun

questions.question: This man is considered the Father of American Accordionists.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pietro Deiro

questions.question: This comedian said, The least said English sentence is The Delorean belongs to the accordionist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Carson
